qas.question: When was Saint Helena first settled?
What was the population of the island in 1659
Where were slaves initially brought from to the island?
Later on, what two locations were slaves brought from?
Which year did the inhabitants decide there were too many slaves?

context: Saint Helena was first settled by the English in <a0_0>1659<a0_0/>, and the island has a population of about <a1_0>4,250<a1_0/> inhabitants, mainly descended from people from Britain – settlers ("planters") and soldiers – and slaves who were brought there from the beginning of settlement – initially from <a2_0>Africa<a2_0/> (the Cape Verde Islands, Gold Coast and west coast of Africa are mentioned in early records), then <a3_0>India and Madagascar<a3_0/>. Eventually the planters felt there were too many slaves and no more were imported after <a4_0>1792<a4_0/>.
